p: This line was extracted in 1977 from human epithelial colorectal adenocarcinoma cells; under specific culture conditions, the cells are able to differentiate into small intestine enterocytes ( 64). This cell line is frequently used to study transfection, invasion, and absorption ( 65). It has been used in studies of MERS-CoV, SARS-CoV, and HCoV-NL63 ( 27, 66, 67), and in the analysis of the S protein activation in studies with SARS-CoV-2, due to the fact that these cells express the TMPRSS2 protease ( 23).
